articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel said it carried out a strike in Syria against extremists who attacked members of the Druze community, following through on a promise to protect the minority group as sectarian violence spread near Damascus on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israel says it hit extremists in Syria to protect Druze

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: Islamabad said it condemned terrorism in all forms and will respond "assuredly and decisively" to any military action from India.
articles.title: Pakistan says intelligence suggests Indian military action likely soon

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The United States on Wednesday imposed sanctions on entities it accused of being involved in the illicit trade of Iranian petroleum and petrochemicals ahead of a new round of U.S.-Iran negotiations on Saturday, as Washington seeks to ramp up pressure on Tehran.
articles.title: US targets Iran with fresh sanctions ahead of next nuclear talks

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Columbia University student Mohsen Mahdawi was released from U.S. immigration custody on Wednesday, after a judge ruled he should be free on bail to challenge the Trump administration's efforts to deport him over his participation in pro-Palestinian protests.
articles.title: Palestinian student released on bail as he challenges deportation from US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine is ready to sign a mineral resources deal with the United States and could do so later on Wednesday, a Ukrainian government source told Reuters.
articles.title: Kyiv ready to sign resources deal with US, Ukraine government source says

articles.author: Michael Martina
articles.description: U.S. lawmakers have asked the State Department to brief them about Russia's use of Chinese fighters in its war in Ukraine, saying in a letter to Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Wednesday that Moscow could only employ Chinese mercenaries with Beijing's "tacit approval."
articles.title: US lawmakers ask Rubio for answers on Chinese fighters in Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin is open to peace in Ukraine and intense work is going on with the United States, but the conflict is so complicated that the rapid progress that Washington wants is difficult to achieve, the Kremlin said.
articles.title: Kremlin says Putin is open to Ukraine peace but warns against rushing a deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Five Indian citizens were kidnapped in western Niger during an attack last week by armed men that also killed a dozen soldiers, according to two Nigerian security sources and a statement by Indian state authorities seen by Reuters on Wednesday.
articles.title: Five Indians kidnapped in attack in Niger

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: The United States has secured the release from Belarus of an American who was arrested in Moscow and held on coup plot allegations, a senior U.S. official told Reuters on Wednesday.
articles.title: US secures release from Belarus of Minsk-born American, US official says
Romanian presidential election could bring ultranationalist to power
